definition: to sting or bite (of mosquito, bee etc)/to say repeatedly/to urge insistently/to ask repeatedly/to stick to a point/(onom.) tinkling or jingling sound

sentences.english: The spring water comes out gently and euphoniously.
sentences.chinese: 泉水叮咚，彈一曲心中舒緩的歌。

sentences.english: If the roof drops beads, drops deep pool ding-dong sound, it is called "supernatural spring."
sentences.chinese: 洞頂水滴若珠，滴入深池叮咚作響，名曰“靈異泉”。

sentences.english: Now I hear them --- Ding-dong, bell.
sentences.chinese: 我現在聽到了叮咚的喪鐘。

sentences.english: Buzz has been one of the most anticipated service offered by Yahoo.
sentences.chinese: 叮咚一直是由雅虎提供的最令人期待的服務之一。

sentences.english: Ding-dong, the Wicked Witch is dead.
In the forest, there are clear streams and tinkling spring water everywhere.
sentences.chinese: 叢林裏到處都有清澈的溪流和叮咚的泉水。

sentences.english: There's going to be a real ding-dong when the bell goes.
sentences.chinese: 當鈴響的時候，就真的是叮咚一下。

definition: (onom.) pattering sound/drip drip (of water)/tick tock (of clock)/also pr. [di1 da5]
sharp and clear/crisp/melodious/ringing/tinkling/silvery (of sound)/fragile/frail/also written 輕脆|轻脆
Dongdong, cheerleading mascot of 2008 Beijing Olympics
sharp and clear/crisp/melodious/ringing/tinkling/silvery (of sound)/fragile/frail/also written 清脆
